column1: Telephone numbers in Indonesia have different systems for land lines and mobile phones: land lines use area codes

column2: the digit "0" is added in front when dialing domestic long distance from within Indonesia
column3: but is always omitted when calling from abroad. Instead
column4: callers would use the Indonesian country code +62
column6: without the "0". Domestic phone numbers in large cities have 8 digits
column7: and in other areas 7 digits. Mobile phone numbers have a total of 10 or 11 digits for postpaid depending on the operator
column8: whereas prepaid services get 11 to 13 digits determined by the operator.

column2: East Timor was included in the Indonesian telephone numbering plan
column3: using the area codes 0390 (for Dili) and 0399 (for Baucau).To make a phone call to Indonesia from abroad
followed by the area code and subscriber's number
column5: hence a number in Jakarta would be dialled as +62 21 xxx xxxx.

column1: For calls to mobile wireless phone (GSM) from abroad
On business cards and other contact information
column2: telephone numbers might be listed as "HP" or "hunting".  "HP" is an abbreviation for "hand phone" or mobile phone and is pronounced "hah péh".  Hand phones might also be referred to as pon-sel (short form of telepon seluler) or telepon genggam ("hold-in-the-hand telephone"). Hunting refers to an office line in which multiple individual lines are connected so that an incoming call can roll over to another line if the first line is busy.  This permits only one number to be published.

column1: xxx xxxx Calls within an area code
yyy xxx xxxx Calls inside Indonesia in city centers
+62 yyy xxxx xxxx Calls from outside Indonesia
+62 8nn xxxx xxxx Calls to mobiles from outside Indonesia
